question.name: 18.3.3.2 T Nature of stationary points
question.questiontext:
Exercise

Determine the nature of the stationary points of \(f(x,y) = {@f@}\), which are \(({@x1@},{@y1@})\) and \(({@x2@},{@y1@})\).

First, write down the three second partial derivatives:

\(f_{xx} = \) [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

\(f_{yy} = \) [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]

\(f_{xy} = \) [[input:ans3]] [[validation:ans3]] [[feedback:prt3]]

Now complete the table below, determining the nature of the stationary points:

Point \(({@x1@},{@y1@})\) \(({@x2@},{@y1@})\)
\(f_{xx}\) [[input:tans11]] [[validation:tans11]] [[feedback:tprt11]] [[input:tans12]] [[validation:tans12]] [[feedback:tprt12]]
\(f_{yy}\) [[input:tans21]] [[validation:tans21]] [[feedback:tprt21]] [[input:tans22]] [[validation:tans22]] [[feedback:tprt22]]
\(f_{xy}\) [[input:tans31]] [[validation:tans31]] [[feedback:tprt31]] [[input:tans32]] [[validation:tans32]] [[feedback:tprt32]]
\(D\) [[input:tans41]] [[validation:tans41]] [[feedback:tprt41]] [[input:tans42]] [[validation:tans42]] [[feedback:tprt42]]
Nature [[input:tans51]] [[validation:tans51]] [[feedback:tprt51]] [[input:tans52]] [[validation:tans52]] [[feedback:tprt52]]
question.generalfeedback:
We are asked to find the nature of the stationary points of \(f(x,y) = {@f@}\), which are given to be \(({@x1@},{@y1@})\) and \(({@x2@},{@y1@})\).

First, we find the three second partial derivatives:

\[\begin{aligned} f_{xx} &= {@f_xx@} \\ f_{yy} &= {@f_yy@} \\ f_{xy} &= {@f_xy@} \end{aligned}\]

Now we work through each stationary point separately. Recall that the formula for \(D\) is given by

\[ D = f_{xx} \cdot f_{yy} - (f_{xy})^2. \]

At \(({@x1@},{@y1@})\), we have:

\[\begin{aligned} f_{xx}({@x1@},{@y1@}) &= {@ta11@} \\ f_{yy}({@x1@},{@y1@}) &= {@ta21@} \\ f_{xy}({@x1@},{@y1@}) &= {@ta31@} \end{aligned}\]

It follows that \(D = {@ta11@} \cdot {@ta21@} - ({@ta31@})^2\) is {@D1sign@}. Using the sign of \(D\) and \(f_{xx}\), we conclude that \(({@x1@},{@y1@})\) is a {@first(mcq_correct(ta51))@}.

At \(({@x2@},{@y1@})\), we have:

\[\begin{aligned} f_{xx}({@x2@},{@y1@}) &= {@ta12@} \\ f_{yy}({@x2@},{@y1@}) &= {@ta22@} \\ f_{xy}({@x2@},{@y1@}) &= {@ta32@} \end{aligned}\]

It follows that \(D = {@ta12@} \cdot {@ta22@} - ({@ta32@})^2\) is {@D2sign@}. Using the sign of \(D\) and \(f_{xx}\), we conclude that \(({@x2@},{@y1@})\) is a {@first(mcq_correct(ta52))@}.

stackoptions.prtcorrect: Correct answer, well done.
stackoptions.prtpartiallycorrect: Your answer is partially correct.
stackoptions.prtincorrect: Incorrect answer.
